com.ibm.team.repository.client

Interface IContentManagerSession


  • public interface IContentManagerSession
    Encapsulates a file transfer session for the IContentManager. A session is a group of zero or more downloads/uploads that are logically related. Downloads are performed with retrieveContent(IContent, IDownloadHandler), which takes an IDownloadHandler as an argument. The IDownloadHandler receives the download (possibly in another thread). Uploads are performed with #storeContent(InputStream in, IUploadHandler), which takes an IUploadHandler as an argument. The IUploadHandler receives the resulting IContent (possibly in another thread).

    If one download or upload is canceled, then implementors should cause all downloads and uploads to be canceled. Any subsequent call to one of IContentManagerSession's methods will result in an OperationCanceledException.

    Sample usage: 

     IContentManager manager;
 IContent content1, content2;
 
 IContentManagerSession session = manager.createSession("Sample download", 2,
                null);
 
 DownloadAdapter dl = new DownloadAdapter() {
        public void downloadCompletedEvent(IContent content) {
                System.out.println("Download completed");
        }
 };
 
 session.retrieveContent(content1, dl);
 session.retrieveContent(content2, dl);
 
 session.join();
 
 session.getErrorStatus();
    Since:
    0.5

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrementTransferCount(int howMuch)
      Tell the receiver to update the progress monitor to indicate that one of the transfers requested at initialization is no longer necessary.
      org.eclipse.core.runtime.IStatus[] getErrorStatus()
      If all transfers completed successfully (or successfully so far), then an OK error status is returned.
      boolean isCanceled()
      Test to see if the session has been canceled.
      void join()
      Cause the calling thread to suspend until all transfers are complete.
      void retrieveContent(IContent content, IDownloadHandler handler)

      void storeContent(IUploadHandler handler)
      Add a new upload request to the receiver.

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveContent

        void retrieveContent(IContent content,
                   IDownloadHandler handler)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Add a new download request to the receiver.
        Parameters:
        content - A content object that identifies the bytes to download. The content must be exactly as it was when downloaded from the server.
        handler - A handler that specifies how the received content is to be treated.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if one or more of the downloads owned by this session has already been canceled.
        TeamRepositoryException

      • storeContent

        void storeContent(IUploadHandler handler)
                  throws TeamRepositoryException
        Add a new upload request to the receiver.
        Parameters:
        handler - A handler that specifies how the sent content is to be treated.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if one or more of the transfers owned by this session has already been canceled.
        TeamRepositoryException

      • isCanceled

        boolean isCanceled()
        Test to see if the session has been canceled.
        Returns:
        true if the session has received a cancel event, false otherwise.

      • join

        void join()
          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Cause the calling thread to suspend until all transfers are complete.
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if one or more of the transfers has been canceled.
        TeamRepositoryException - on any error.

      • decrementTransferCount

        void decrementTransferCount(int howMuch)
        Tell the receiver to update the progress monitor to indicate that one of the transfers requested at initialization is no longer necessary.
        Parameters:
        howMuch - The number of transfers to decrement.

      • getErrorStatus

        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IStatus[] getErrorStatus()
        If all transfers completed successfully (or successfully so far), then an OK error status is returned. If one or more of the transfers encountered an error or a cancellation, a multistatus containing an error/cancellation for each.
